required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: RELIEF - A Global Registry to Evaluate Long-Term Effectiveness of Neurostimulation Therapy for Pain
clinical_study.official_title: A Global Registry to Evaluate Long-Term Effectiveness of Neurostimulation Therapy for Pain

brief_summary.textblock:
To compile characteristics of real-world clinical outcomes for Boston Scientific commercially approved neurostimulation systems for pain in routine clinical practice, when used according to the applicable Directions for Use
- and -
To evaluate the economic value and technical performance of Boston Scientific commercially approved neurostimulation systems for pain in routine clinical practice

detailed_description.textblock:
The study is a prospective, multi-center, global registry of Boston Scientific neurostimulation systems for pain.
The study treatment will consist of neurostimulation trial therapy with any commercially approved Boston Scientific Corporation neurostimulator for pain. Positive trials, subjects with a successful trial outcome, may progress to permanent implant of a neurostimulation system. Individualization of neurostimulation therapy for pain will be determined according to investigator discretion and site routine care, and in accordance with inclusion and exclusion criteria.

primary_outcome.description: Subject-reported percent pain relief of targeted pain at 6 months post neurostimulation trial

secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of Neurostimulation Trial, 12, 24, and 36 months post neurostimulation trial
secondary_outcome.description: Percent pain relief of targeted pain as reported by the Subject

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from Baseline to End of Neurostimulation Trial, 6, 12, 24, and 36 months post neurostimulation trial
secondary_outcome.description: Change in intensity of targeted pain as reported by the Subject

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from Baseline to 6, 12, 24, and 36 months post neurostimulation trial
secondary_outcome.description: Change in physical functioning as reported by the Subject

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from Baseline to 6, 12, 24, and 36 months post neurostimulation trial
secondary_outcome.description: Change in quality of life as reported by the Subject
Clinical global impression as reported by the physician
Subject global impression as reported by the Subject

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from Baseline to 12 and 36 months post neurostimulation trial
secondary_outcome.description: Change in depression as reported by the Subject

secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of neurostimulation trial, IPG implantation, 6, 12, 24, and 36 months post neurostimulation trial
secondary_outcome.description: Paresthesia coverage of targeted pain (a tingling sensation associated with neurostimulation therapy) as reported by the Subject

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from Baseline to 6, 12, 24, and 36 months post neurostimulation trial
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the total amount of physician-prescribed, pain-related medications used

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at End of neurostimulation trial, IPG implantation, 6, 12, 24, and 36 months post neurostimulation trial
secondary_outcome.description: Satisfaction with treatment as reported by the Subject
Progression to permanent implantation with a Boston Scientific neurostimulation system by 12 months post neurostimulation trial
Patient ease of use of the implanted system, as reported by the Subject

other_outcome.time_frame: from Baseline to 6, 12, 24, and 36 months post neurostimulation trial
other_outcome.description: Change in employment as reported by the Subject

other_outcome.time_frame: from Baseline to 6, 12, 24, and 36 months post neurostimulation trial

other_outcome.description: Rate of device-related and procedure-related Adverse Events (AEs) from trial lead insertion through completion of study
Rate of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) from informed consent through completion of study

arm_group.description: Subjects permanently implanted with a Boston Scientific Precision Plus neurostimulation system
Subjects permanently implanted with other Boston Scientific neurostimulation systems

intervention.description: Trial stimulation period, followed by permanent implant of a neurostimulation system for subjects with a positive trial outcome

study_pop.textblock: Subjects who exhibit an on-label indication for neurostimulation to relieve chronic intractable pain, according to the Directions for Use, as applicable in each country or region

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Study candidate is scheduled to be trialed, on-label, with a commercially approved Boston Scientific neurostimulation system for pain, per local directions for use
- Signed a valid, IRB/EC-approved informed consent form
- 18 years of age or older
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindicated for Boston Scientific neurostimulation system
- Currently diagnosed with cognitive impairment, or exhibits any characteristic, that would limit study candidate's ability to assess pain relief or to complete study assessments
